page.title: 11DRUMOAK SCHOOL TV STARS
page.content: In June 1985 a BBC Television Team filmed P7 pupils of Drumoak School for a television series{Odyssey.}The producer first visited the class and did a radio recording of the pupils in which they spoke about the use of {local dialect words}in our everyday speech.A week later he returned with a Television Crew and filmed members of the class using dialect words still in use in the North East. Some of the words are:'pints' - shoe laces,'beets' - boots, 'loon' - boy. A sentence using these words might be:{'The loon {broke the pints o his beets fan he {pit them on'}-' The boy broke his boot laces when he put them on'. After filming in the classroom,two pupils were filmed at Drum Castle telling the story of a Scots ballad - The Laird o Drum. The programme called{'The Mother {Tongue'}is due to be shown Oct. 1985.
